contest-event.event-date: Sept. 29, 1906 D National Championship of Great Britain (Crystal Palace) National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) 1 Test Piece Contest National Championship of Great Britain (Finals) national-finals-championship-section European Championships The current Nationals contest began in 1900, but there was a previous 'Nationals' contest run 40 years earlier: Enderby Jackson's Great National Contest. Championship Gems of Chopin [arr. Short] Crystal Palace (Concert Hall), Crystal Palace Park, Sydenham, County of London, England, UK Prizes: 1st: 40 Pounds plus 1000 Guinea Trophy (Total prize valued at £1,142) 2nd: 30 Pounds plus Daily Telegraph cup 3rd: 20 Pounds plus 'A' quality contesting cornet 4th: 16 Pounds plus music goods valued at 12 guineas 5th: 12 Pounds plus tenor slide trombone 6th: 10 Pounds plus Coortois Sopiano cornet 7th: 5 Pounds plus bandstands valued at £4.10s Linthwaite disqualified after being placed 2nd Oct. 21, 2010, 10:33 p.m. March 8, 2014, 10:33 a.m. 1 Wingates Band William Rimmer 2 Shaw Band William Rimmer 3 Wyke William Rimmer 4 Pemberton Old Wigan DW Band William Rimmer 5 BMP (Europe) Goodshaw Band William Halliwell 6 Irwell Springs William Rimmer Unknown Result Hebburn Colliery Angus Holden Unknown Result Hebden Bridge Band William Heap Unknown Result Rushden Windmill Band William Rimmer Unknown Result Dannemora Steelworks Robert Richford Unknown Result Gossage Soap Works William Rimmer Unknown Result Kettering Town Silver Band Randolph Ryan Unknown Result Barrow Shipyard Band Peter Fairhurst Unknown Result Aberaman Thomas Valentine Unknown Result Luton Band Angus Holden Unknown Result Irwell Bank William Rimmer Unknown Result Felling Band William Heap Unknown Result Tonyrefail Silver Prize Band Henry Bentley Unknown Result Oldham Rifles Band Alexander Owen Unknown Result Kettering Rifles Thomas Preston Unknown Result Slaithwaite Band Angus Holden Disqualified Linthwaite Silver Band Alfred Gray Withdrawn Earlestown Viaduct William Rimmer
